identifier: The vehicle information ontology contains the product master data.

synonyms_en: vehicle infos, vehicle details, vehicle specs, vehicle configuration, vehicle master data

definition_en: customer series number
synonyms_en: model range, series, range, sales series, sales designation

definition_en: specification of the vehicle model
internal series number
synonyms_en: development series, development model range, e-series, derivative, development code
synonyms_de: Entwicklungsbaureihe, E-Baureihe, E-Reihe, Derivat, Entwicklungscode, Entwicklungsbaureihe (EBR), Baureihe, Entwicklungsbezeichnung

definition_en: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).
Indicates the design and body style of the vehicle (e.g. station wagon, hatchback, etc.).
The number of doors.
aerodynamic drag coefficient
The color of the product.
The number of persons that can be seated (e.g. in a vehicle), both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.
The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.
is defined by the location of the engine and drive wheels
The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).
The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.
The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).
The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.
The number of axles.
Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.
The power of the vehicle's engine. Typical unit code(s): KWT for kilowatt, BHP for brake horsepower, N12 for metric horsepower (PS, with 1 PS = 735,49875 W)
The torque (turning force) of the vehicle's engine.
The volume swept by all of the pistons inside the cylinders of an internal combustion engine in a single movement.
Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.
The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.
The capacity of the fuel tank or in the case of electric cars, the battery. If there are multiple components for storage, this should indicate the total of all storage of the same type.
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).
The euro emission class is a measure of a vehicle's emissions, calculated using a standard testing procedure. The higher the vehicle euro class, the less emissions the vehicle produces.
The CO2 emissions in g/km. When used in combination with a QuantitativeValue, put "g/km" into the unitText property of that value, since there is no UN/CEFACT Common Code for "g/km".
The CO2 emissions in g/km. When used in combination with a QuantitativeValue, put "g/km" into the unitText property of that value, since there is no UN/CEFACT Common Code for "g/km".
The speed range of the vehicle. If the vehicle is powered by an engine, the upper limit of the speed range (indicated by maxValue should be the maximum speed achievable under regular conditions.
The time needed to accelerate the vehicle from 0 to 100 km/h.
The time needed to decelerate the vehicle from 100 to 0 km/h.
The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.
The distance between the centers of the front and rear wheels.

The total mass of a vehicle with standard equipment and all necessary operating consumables such as motor oil, transmission oil, brake fluid, coolant, air conditioning refrigerant, and sometimes a full tank of fuel, while not loaded with either passengers or cargo.
Dry weight is the weight of a vehicle without any consumables, passengers, or cargo.
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.
The permitted weight of passengers and cargo, EXCLUDING the weight of the empty vehicle.
The permitted vertical load (TWR) of a trailer attached to the vehicle. Also referred to as Tongue Load Rating (TLR) or Vertical Load Rating (VLR)
The permitted weight of a trailer attached to the vehicle.
The permitted total weight of the loaded vehicle, including passengers and cargo and the weight of the empty vehicle.

synonyms_en: gross vehicle mass (GVM), Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR)

definition_en: The date the vehicle was ordered by the owner.
The date the vehicle was purchased by the owner.
The date of production of the vehicle.
The place where the product was assembled.
Full name of owner.

synonyms_en: number plate, license plate, licence plate, vehicle registration number

definition_en: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.
4-digit numeric code to identify the vehicle manufacturer that is given in the vehicle license.
8-digit alphanumeric code to identify the vehicle model that is given in the vehicle license.
The current mileage of the vehicle in km.
The current age of the vehicle in years.

synonyms_en: manual transmission (MT), manual gearbox, standard transmission, stick shift

definition_en: cars for for right-hand traffic
cars for for left-hand traffic
Number of doors always including hatch, excluding trunk.
4WD refers to a two-axled vehicle drivetrain capable of providing torque to all of its wheels simultaneously.
6WD refers to a three-axled vehicle drivetrain capable of providing torque to all of its wheels simultaneously.
8WD refers to a four-axled vehicle drivetrain capable of providing torque to all of its wheels simultaneously.

synonyms_en: body design, body type, body category

definition_en: A car with a sloping or truncated rear roofline and two doors.
A car that can be driven with or without a roof in place.
An open two-seat car with emphasis on sporting appearance or character
A car combined with elements of road and off-road cars, such as raised ground clearance and four-wheel drive.
A car that is capable of driving on and off paved or gravel surface.
by cathode material
The company that produced the vehicle encoded in the VIN.
The first 3 digits of the VIN that uniquely identifies the manufacturer of a vehicle.
The first digit of the VIN.
The first 2 digits of the VIN.
